trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for Android apps
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for Android apps

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Android development.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Android development.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.INCLUDE [mobile-services-selector-get-started](../../includes/mobile-services-selector-get-started.md)]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.INCLUDE [mobile-services-selector-get-started](../../includes/mobile-services-selector-get-started.md)]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an Android app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an Android app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple _To do list_ app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple _To do list_ app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The mobile service that you will create uses the supported .NET languages using Visual Studio for server-side business logic and to manage the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service that you will create uses the supported .NET languages using Visual Studio for server-side business logic and to manage the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the [JavaScript backend version](mobile-services-android-get-started.md) of this topic.
trans-unit.target: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the [JavaScript backend version](mobile-services-android-get-started.md) of this topic.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot from the completed app is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial requires the [Android Developer Tools][Android Studio], which includes the Android Studio integrated development environment, and the latest Android platform.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial requires the [Android Developer Tools][Android Studio], which includes the Android Studio integrated development environment, and the latest Android platform.

trans-unit.source: Android 4.2 or a later version is required.
trans-unit.target: Android 4.2 or a later version is required.

trans-unit.source: The downloaded quickstart project contains the Mobile Services SDK for Android.
trans-unit.target: The downloaded quickstart project contains the Mobile Services SDK for Android.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=AE564AB28).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=AE564AB28).

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Download the mobile service to your local computer
trans-unit.target: Download the mobile service to your local computer

trans-unit.source: Now that you have created the mobile service, download your personalized mobile service project that you can run on your local computer or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have created the mobile service, download your personalized mobile service project that you can run on your local computer or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click the mobile service that you just created, then in the quickstart tab, click **Android** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Android app**.
trans-unit.target: Click the mobile service that you just created, then in the quickstart tab, click **Android** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Android app**.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install [Visual Studio Professional 2013](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=391934), or a later version.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install [Visual Studio Professional 2013](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=391934), or a later version.

trans-unit.source: In Step 2, click **Download** under **Download and publish your service to the cloud**.
trans-unit.target: In Step 2, click **Download** under **Download and publish your service to the cloud**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the Visual Studio project that implements your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the Visual Studio project that implements your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.

trans-unit.source: Test the mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the mobile service

trans-unit.source: Publish your mobile service
trans-unit.target: Publish your mobile service

trans-unit.source: Create a new Android app
trans-unit.target: Create a new Android app

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create a new Android app that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create a new Android app that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure classic portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure classic portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click **Android** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Android app**.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click **Android** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new Android app**.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install the [Android Developer Tools][Android SDK] on your local computer or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install the [Android Developer Tools][Android SDK] on your local computer or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and run your app**, click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and run your app**, click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the project for the sample _To do list_ application that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the project for the sample _To do list_ application that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: Run your Android app
trans-unit.target: Run your Android app

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source:
[Add push notifications to your app]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Add push notifications to your app]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.

trans-unit.source:
[Add authentication to your app]
Learn how to restrict access to your backend data to specific registered users of your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Add authentication to your app]
Learn how to restrict access to your backend data to specific registered users of your app.

trans-unit.source:
[Troubleshoot a Mobile Services .NET backend]
Learn how to diagnose and fix issues that can arise with a Mobile Services .NET backend.
trans-unit.target:
[Troubleshoot a Mobile Services .NET backend]
Learn how to diagnose and fix issues that can arise with a Mobile Services .NET backend.
